title: Social Information Technology Awareness Campaign 2017 by ACSES, WCE Sangli
name: Social Information Technology Awareness Campaign 2017
body:
NOTE: I kindly request you to check out the Social IT Awareness Campaign (SITAC) in the "Community Service/Outreach" section of the page's sidebar before going through this page.

  • We taught the students about computer technologies and programming. We taught them the compiler's role using an analogy of 3 persons drawn on the board and asked one of the students to reexplain the concept to all of us as part of revision.
    The student explains the compiler's concept by an analogy of 3 persons drawn on the board. 2 persons at the extreme right and left speak different languages. The person in the middle speaks both languages. The persons at the extremes use the middle person to facilitate the communication between them. This is just how we communicate with the processor with the use of the compiler as a middleman.
  • I am explaining the difference between the hardware and the software to the students and making them realize that they should have complete knowledge of their daily computing devices.
  • It's time for revision! One of the student summaries all the concepts we learned today.
  • My teammate and friend, Yash Bele, explain the concept of binary numbers and their importance in computing.
  • Yash and I conducted a joint session on parts of the computer.
  • ACSES volunteer and our junior friend, Abhinav Ananth, is explaining the importance of CPU.
